snippet: Mark Kitto, an entrepreneur, is leaving China after 16 years, citing concerns about raising his children and saying the state protects its power at the people’s expense.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Mark Kitto, foreign entrepreneur in China who is leaving country after 16 years; Kitto cites concerns about raising his children in China, describes hardships of sustaining a business there and of government that sacrifices well-being of its people to protect its power.
lead_paragraph: Mark Kitto, an entrepreneur, is leaving China after 16 years, citing concerns about raising his children and saying the state protects its power at the people’s expense.

headline.main: A Briton’s Bitter Farewell to China Echoes Loudly
headline.print_headline: A Briton’s Bitter Farewell to China Echoes Loudly
